greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of the prime indices of n minus the number of distinct positive subset-sums of the prime indices of n.
comment: A prime index of n is a number m such that prime(m) divides n. The multiset of prime indices of n is row n of A112798, with sum A056239(n). A positive subset-sum of an integer partition is any sum of a nonempty submultiset of it.
example: The prime indices of 21 are {2,4}, with positive subset-sums {2,4,6}, so a(21) = 6 - 3 = 3.
xref: Positions of nonzero terms are A325798.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, May 23 2019
